en.purpose: To calculate and interpret the total sum for Braden score.
en.use:
The Braden score is used in immobile or chronically hospitalized patients to identify patients who are at a risk of developing pressure ulcers. The score is calculated based on six different areas: activity, moisture, mobility, nutrition, sensory perception, and friction and shear. 5 input fields- activity, moisture, mobility, nutrition and sensory perception- have 4 grades with +1 denoting worst outcome and +4 denoting best outcome. The input field, friction and shear, has 3 grades with +1 denoting worst outcome and +3 denoting best outcome. These six areas form the input fields. Fill in all the input fields to calculate the total score and derive its interpretation.

The interpretation of the total score, given as risk for developing pressure ulcers, is as follows:

<= 12 High risk

>= 13 <= 15 Moderate risk

>= 16 <= 17 Mild risk

>= 18 Average risk
en.misuse: The score should not be used by itself, but should be used in conjunction with clinical assessment as it does not capture all risk factors of developing pressure ulcers. The score should not be calculated only once, periodic assessments are necessary.

other_details.references: Bergstrom N, Braden BJ, Laguzza A, Holman V. The Braden scale for predicting pressure sore risk. Nurs Res. 1987;36(4):205-10.
other_details.en: Braden score identifies patients at risk of developing pressure ulcers.

gt0001.description: An assessment score to identify patients at risk of developing pressure ulcers.

gt0004.description: The quality of patient's skin in terms of wetness/ moisture is graded in this field.

gt0005.description: The patient's activity levels are documented here.

gt0006.description: This field grades the independance the patient has in terms of making changes in body positions.

gt0007.description: The status of patient's food intake is graded here.

gt0008.description: When the patient requires assistance to move around or change body positions, the skin often rubs against surfaces that creates friction and may result in skin breakdown.

gt0010.description: The total score calculated by adding up individual scores of the 6 input fields.

gt0011.description: The risk of developing pressure ulcers given by classification of Braden score into 4 categories.

gt0012.description: This rule adds up the valus of all input fields to derive the total score.

gt0013.description: This rule interprets the risk category as "high" when the total score is <= 12.

gt0014.description: This rule interprets the risk category as "moderate" when the total score is <= 15 and >= 13.

gt0015.description: This rule interprets the risk category as "moderate" when the total score is <= 17 and >= 16

gt0016.description: This rule interprets the risk category as "average" when the total score is >= 18
